body:
**Warning**: ~~I'm currently fixing up OpenCV to add the `contrib` modules as a variant, but note that the checksum for v3.3.0 has changed (see `md5sum` at end for what it is now).~~ somebody already patched the archive md5 change on latest develop

If I try to install, I get this error:

```console
$ spack install opencv +python ^python@3.6.2+tk
==> pkg-config is already installed in /opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora25-x86_64/gcc-6.4.1/pkg-config-0.29.2-u6vwetoqqexka5zke44zqyiduvilfozf
...
==> Installing opencv
==> Fetching https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Fetching from https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for opencv-3.3.0-rriph3folljzrhmxpq7emhcqgkrimfzd
FetchError: FetchError: All fetchers failed for opencv-3.3.0-rriph3folljzrhmxpq7emhcqgkrimfzd

/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:978, in do_fetch:
     25                                     self.spec.format('$_$@'), ck_msg)
     26    
     27            self.stage.create()
  >> 28            self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
     29            self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
     30    
     31            if spack.do_checksum and self.version in self.versions:
```

If I try and fetch, I get:

```console
$ spack fetch opencv +python ^python@3.6.2+tk                                                                                     
==> Fetching https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Fetching from https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: All fetchers failed for opencv-3.3.0-rriph3folljzrhmxpq7emhcqgkrimfzd
```

If I just download it:

```console
$ wget https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz
--2017-11-07 06:44:10--  https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz
Resolving github.com (github.com)... 192.30.253.112, 192.30.253.113
Connecting to github.com (github.com)|192.30.253.112|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 301 Moved Permanently
Location: https://github.com/opencv/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz [following]
--2017-11-07 06:44:10--  https://github.com/opencv/opencv/archive/3.3.0.tar.gz
Reusing existing connection to github.com:443.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 302 Found
Location: https://codeload.github.com/opencv/opencv/tar.gz/3.3.0 [following]
--2017-11-07 06:44:10--  https://codeload.github.com/opencv/opencv/tar.gz/3.3.0
Resolving codeload.github.com (codeload.github.com)... 192.30.253.120, 192.30.253.121
Connecting to codeload.github.com (codeload.github.com)|192.30.253.120|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 81238534 (77M) [application/x-gzip]
Saving to: ‘3.3.0.tar.gz’

3.3.0.tar.gz                            100%[=============================================================================>]  77.47M   419KB/s    in 4m 35s  

2017-11-07 06:48:46 (288 KB/s) - ‘3.3.0.tar.gz’ saved [81238534/81238534]

$ md5sum 3.3.0.tar.gz 
98a4e4c6f23ec725e808a891dc11eec4  3.3.0.tar.gz
```

I'm not sure what's going on here.  How do I circumvent this?
title: github archive fetcher spazzing out?
